abstract: Despite fiscal austerity in Washington, the private sector is helping create jobs and force the overall unemployment rate in April down to its lowest level since the end of 2008.
snippet: Despite fiscal austerity in Washington, the private sector is helping create jobs and force the overall unemployment rate in April down to its lowest level since the end of 2008.
lead_paragraph: Washington may be hitting the brakes, but the private sector is still rolling ahead, helping create nearly 200,000 jobs a month, on average, since the beginning of the year and forcing the overall unemployment rate in April down to its lowest level since the end of 2008.

headline.main: Jobs Data Eases Fears of Economic Slowdown in U.S.
headline.print_headline: Jobs Data Eases Fears Of a Sharp Slowdown; Joblessness Dips to 7.5%
